concise_definition: n. 快乐, 愉快, 乐事; v. 使高兴, 使满意

definitions.explanation_en: A feeling of happy satisfaction or enjoyment derived from an experience, activity, or sensation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从某种经历、活动或感官体验中获得的快乐、满足或愉悦感。
definitions.example_en: Reading novels is one of my greatest pleasures.
definitions.example_cn: 阅读小说是我最大的乐事之一。

definitions.explanation_en: An activity or thing that gives enjoyment or satisfaction, often used in plural form to refer to indulgences or delights.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指能带来享受或满足的活动或事物，常以复数形式表示享乐或消遣。
definitions.example_en: The pleasures of life include good food, music, and companionship.
definitions.example_cn: 生活的乐趣包括美食、音乐和陪伴。

definitions.explanation_en: To give someone enjoyment or satisfaction; to please or gratify someone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人感到愉快或满足；取悦或讨好某人。
definitions.example_en: It would pleasure me greatly if you could join us for dinner.
definitions.example_cn: 如果你能来和我们一起吃晚饭，我会非常高兴。

comparison.analysis: “Enjoyment” (享受) 更侧重于持续的、内在的愉悦体验，常用于描述对活动或状态的主观感受，语气较中性。而 “pleasure” 不仅可指感受，还可指具体的乐事，且在动词用法中更强调主动取悦他人，语义范围更广。
“Delight” (喜悦) 通常表达更强烈、更兴奋的愉悦，常带有惊喜或赞叹的色彩，语气比 “pleasure” 更浓烈。例如，孩子的笑容带来的是 delight，而一杯好茶带来的可能是 pleasure。
“Satisfaction” (满足) 强调目标达成或需求被满足后的心理状态，常与责任、成就相关，情感色彩较理性。而 “pleasure” 更偏向感官或情感上的直接愉悦，不必然与目标达成有关。
